website_summaries.verdict: The dimensions of this dog ramp may be better suited for larger vehicles, but owners report very few problems encouraging its use.
pros: Ideal for larger dog breeds and farm animals
Telescoping design more secure than folding models
Aluminum construction is rust-resistant and lightweight
Sturdy base and good traction on tread
cons: Grip tape not as strong as ribbed rubber
Design is awkward for one-person carries

website_summaries.verdict: Manufacturer has addressed the slickness issue with thicker carpeting. Great choice for smaller dogs who enjoy climbing into bed with owners.
pros: Longer ramp means gentler incline for older dogs
Fits easily along the side of a bed
Solid furniture-like construction that is built to last
cons: Original carpeting can be very slick
Construction can be challenging, holes misaligned

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Goat Ramp!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. I will probably order another in the future. I use it for loading our goats in the back of our tall pickup. We take them for parades and different events. It has saved my back from lifting and pulling on the heavy boys. After a bit of training and feed, of course, our boys go right up it. No slipping on their part or from the ramp. They weigh around 150 each and it holds up just fine for them!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Allison

customer_reviews.title: Best dog ramp available !
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery--quality product---worked as advertised and was the best ramp of all that I checked out and very competitive on price. We used a rubber backed bath mat that our black lab was use to as the non slippery surface was foreign to his feel. Worked real slick. Get your dog use to ramp laying it flat and using treats gradually increase grade.
customer_reviews.author: harv

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so my German shepherd could get into the house following knee surgery. It has been 2.5 weeks since her surgery, snd she has slipped off of it 4 times! While the surface is gritty, there is nothing for the dog to grip. Adding anything will interfere with contracting the ramp. I bought it so she would be safe, and not reinjure her knee. In addition, there is no possible way this thing could support 300 lbs. I weigh significantly less than half if that, and it bows when I am on it. Disappointing. I do not recommend this ramp.
customer_reviews.author: DiggerGirl

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality control.
customer_reviews.text: Well after having to use a j-roller on the griptape and pop 42 bubbles. Unscrew both peaces and set in the sun. Also grip tape is not set in place correctly. It is horribly crooked. Quality control is not acceptable and is disgraceful. Considering im a contractor and install your products. Maybe ill start using a diffrent brand. Product is only worth $75 i spent 1.5 hours doing your employees job. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Wade B.

customer_reviews.title: Works for Big Dogs
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy just hit the over 100 lbs mark and isn't suppose to (or inclined to) jump up or down from the car. This ramp works well and isn't too heavy. Our only problem is it's big (duh) so it's difficult to store in the SUV with the dog. Can't have the seats in the back down if the ramp is in there. I really don't think that this is a design or product flaw - it's just big dogs need big things ... just thought I'd pass it along. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: This Ramp has Saved Our Backs!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! We bought this after lifting our 75 pound Great Dane puppy was becoming impossible! We love it as well as our Gunner! We have a Silverado pick up and he just runs up and down the ramp to load and unload! No slipping on his part and the ramp stays in place. We also use the ramp to take him on golf cart rides. Our cart has a lift and the ramp works great! I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Taughnya

customer_reviews.title: Industrial strength - if you need it
customer_reviews.text: If you have a really wimpy or injured dog that needs a very wide, very secure and industrial ramp, this is the one for you. But even when folded, it is VERY long. And its heavy. If you have an unusually high truck you might need this one. But I'm not sure why this company decided anyone needs THIS much ramp. It takes up a lot of room in your car (or wherever you store it). So once I found a different ramp that was much easier to use, this one is stored. But I'm keeping it for when my dog gets old or injured and needs a really low angle, wide ramp.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Melle

customer_reviews.title: Loose screws, damage on first use
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box there was a loose screw (glad I saw it first), the safety strap is super hard to get off. And on the first time my 100lb dog walked up it He gouged it in many places. The stuff they have on the bottom for grip comes off super easily. But it gets my dog and my neighbors 170lbs dog up into my Nissan pathfinder just fine. When fully closed it is to long to place it in the back of the car with out having to pay both rows of back seats down. And I now need to find a way to secre it so it doesn't slide around.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Great for bad human backs and senior dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my almost fourteen year old standard poodle. She can't jump and I hurt my back and couldn't lift her anymore. The ramp is light enough that I can lift it even when I'm hurting. I got it for emergencies but it works so well I use it routinely-- she can go to the park with me again! This has worked perfectly for us, I have an F-150 and it is too high for her but not too high for this ramp. I am thrilled, it has improved her quality of life and my peace of my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Nerdmaste

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 12 yr old Sheperd/mix with bad hips and she gets up in the back of our SUV with this ramp with no problems (Except a little coaxing) our 8 year old Sharpei mix runs up it with no problem. No more lifting them uncomfortably for both the dogs and us retired folks. It slides like a telescope to close. Their nails have scratched it up as they grip it, but it hasn't affected the functionality at all. There is no way they could get in the back of the SUV without it. We spent extra to get a good quality one with a long extension to minimize the angle. It was well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Fordham

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry, light but sturdy. Well worth the $
customer_reviews.text: Blessedly simple to set up and extend. The top lip of the ramp sits securely at the base of my rear hatch/bumper It is surprisingly light, but extremely solid and sturdy. The non-slip surface is very helpful after muddy trips to the dog park. The ramp slides easily back to its compact storage size, locking in place with a latch. A carrying handle on one side of the contracted ramp makes for almost effortless carrying in/out of the car. It fits easily in the back of my Edge, with plenty of room for my two big dogs. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tony S.

customer_reviews.title: This works for a 180 lb dog.
customer_reviews.text: It is well designed, strong, and the dog has good traction. A very old 180 lb Great Dane was easy to load into a truck with this ramp. I deducted one star because of the silly snap that was supposed to keep the ramp from sliding open when it was opened, This is a joke. It doesn't hold the ramp and must have been added as an after thought. Certainly the same people who designed the ramp couldn't have been involved in putting this silly thing on. But, the good news is that the useless thing isn't even needed so it doesn't affect the overall utility of this very good dog ramp.
customer_reviews.author: pcsnake

customer_reviews.title: The adaptor kit is dumb btw. It doesn't hook onto anything right so ...
customer_reviews.text: This works very well for our dogs who are 45 and 60 pounds each. It says it can hold 250lbs but I stepped on it and it flexed so much I thought it would break. I'm 150lbs. Also it came damaged. Box was torn and the ramp has a2 inch gouge in the non slip coating. I needed it the weekend I bought it, so I couldn't send it back for a replacement. The adaptor kit is dumb btw. It doesn't hook onto anything right so the ramp is still not really attached. I like the ramp, but there are a few problems obviously.
customer_reviews.author: Kdmt1970

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a large dog with leg issues.
customer_reviews.text: It’s sturdy, it’s strong, two attempts and dog goes up it like a trooper. No slipping. After over a month of a lot of use, the non slip surface is pretty badly scratched but still works well and not slippery unless it gets wet. It does not fold but telescopes to a length 1/2 its fully extended size. But it does take up room in the back of the SUV. And it is cumbersome, heavy and sometimes telescoping is sticky. Otherwise, perfect!!! It works as it should and that’s the important thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. S

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A WINNER !
customer_reviews.text: We have a 90 pound 9 year old golden retriever and we just bought a RAV4 and were worried how we would get her in the back. We had a Camry that she just popped right into. She went right up (with her favorite treat at the top) without much hesitation the third trip up she was a pro. This item is very sturdy and well made. we had purchased a lesser quality that no matter what she was not going up or down. We highly recommend this item and we are both over 70 years young and can handle it quite easily
customer_reviews.author: Charlee

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: First, this is a bit heavy. Second, the damn snap is on the wrong side to be convenient to use as a means to keep it closed. third, it doesn't always stay in place as it should and my dogs hate it. I also notice the skidpad on it is scratching easily and it makes me wonder how long it will last. I wish it folded for easier use in my Jeep Wrangler. It is so big it is hard to store it in the car. Maybe for a different car and different dogs it would be great but for me it's just OK.
customer_reviews.author: K. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Change out the traction(less) sandpaper right away
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical on the reviews I saw. But anybody who wrote about the Sandpaper issue for paw gripping was correct. TOTALLY USELESS FOR DOGS WITH ANY NAILS. My shepherd is 9 years old having some problems with those back legs so I bought this. Luckily the Sandpaper came off easily enough but it still cost me another $34 to put the correct product on the ramp. I used 3M spray adhesive A heavy duty rubber mat for the one section, and a less than 1/4" mat for the part of the ramp the fits under the other part. Took my shepherd 3 times with treats, to get familiar . Manufacturer was wrong to use sandpaper!
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Reilly can get into the car now!
customer_reviews.text: Our 13 1/2 year old border collie isn't able to get into the little SUV anymore. We can't lift him up into it (we're old too). We purchased this ramp, taught him to use it and once again he can go with us to our 2nd home. We just purchase a thin runner rug at Costco to cover part of the ramp as he had trouble with traction on ramp's surface. Found the big ramp was too big to fit into the car to take with us, so ordered the next size down which is left at the other house.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Ramp but has Some Minor Issues
customer_reviews.text: Its a great ramp for my Golden Retriever. He learned to use it easily. Its well engineered, but has some issues with the adhesive abrasive non slip friction material applied to the ramp . My dogs claws (yes they are trimmed) damage this abrasive material on the first use of the ramp. The manufacturer was very responsive and they sent me a new ramp. Unfortunately it still has the same type of friction material. It too was quickly damaged by my dog. The damage is cosmetic only, but it is frustrating. The manufacturer would do well to install a better quality adhesive friction material to the ramp surface.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: This was super helpful for our older dog with knee and hip ...
customer_reviews.text: This was super helpful for our older dog with knee and hip issues. He can't jump in the car himself, and at 70 pounds, I can't put him in it, either. He's 13 years old, and it was super easy to teach him to use. A couple of passes with treats at either end on flat ground, then up a couple of steps, and then to the truck! We have a mid-size truck, so it's a pretty steep angle to get him up to it, but he does it easily with no hesitation. The surface is pretty rough, as others have mentioned, but our dog didn't seem to mind it at all, so we haven't changed it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kim BellTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great aid for elderly dogs
customer_reviews.text: The ramp is well constructed of quality materials and workmanship. It performs as claimed. I was able to train my 2 great danes to use the ramp in a relatively short time. However, they do not like it and continue to jump in and out of the vehicle if given the opportunity. It is easy to collapse the ramp however it is quite heavy and takes up a lot of room if transporting with the dogs. If you only have one dog this probably won't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for LARGE German Shepherd with hip dysplasia
customer_reviews.text: Just got this ramp for our 88 lb german Shepherd due to his hip dysplasia worsening. We are happy with this purchase. The ramp was easy to earn how to use. All you have to do is slide it out to extend it and then snap it together when it’s not extended. Anyone can do it! Our dog learned to use it after just about 6 times up and down. He walked on it just fine. Didn’t seem scared at all. We highly recommend this ramp for in and out of a car. We have a SUV, and the ramp extended fully made for about a 30° angle.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa O.

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy for my dog’s surgery
customer_reviews.text: Got this because we have steps into our house and our 90 lb fur baby had surgery on his back leg so he can’t do stairs. It took a few days to get him to use it , but now he goes up and down no problem. It holds his weight just fine. Also it’s really light and easy to maneuver. Glad we got it before everything got locked down. Side note - If you do get this for a pet after surgery. I would recommend getting it a couple weeks before surgery if possible so they get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: The Southern Peach

customer_reviews.title: Invaluable for my older German Shepherds
customer_reviews.text: I had to add non-slip shelf liner via spray adhesive. My two could not initially climb it. It was too slippery. Once this was added, it has worked like a charm. We had to go to the vet today for my ailing girl who couldn't get into the back seat of the truck by herself like she normally would. We took our 110# boy along for her moral support. He's too old to get in by himself. We're too old to be lifting such dogs anymore ourselves. This ramp made it perfectly smooth and easy for all of us. I'm excited to have this ramp.
customer_reviews.author: bj taylor

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and good angle but horrible sandpaper traction
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Seems really sturdy for my large dogs. After breaking all other stairs, I need something that will last. I also like the locking clasp to keep it from sliding out. It’s pretty long so the angle isn’t too high for my older girl. Cons: Sandpaper “traction” material is HORRIBLE. Seriously, who innovated this? I’ve scratched my finger bloody each time I’ve used it because it’s SO tough and if my fingers just slightly graze the top it cuts me. I am worried that it is rough on my dogs’ feet. Going to take it to Lowe’s to see if they can help me glue something else on top. So for the money spent, I’m not that happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: awesome for road trips!
customer_reviews.text: Received the seat extender and noticed one of the straps was a bit damaged. Reached out to the seller and they were quick to send a replacement (which I am very grateful for!). We used this for our 80+ pound dog to have some more space in the middle row of our SUV...and it worked out awesome! We put a mattress on top of it to make it extra comfortable for him, but this provided a great sturdy platform for him so he was able to rest comfortably during our recent road trip.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Griswold

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is ideal for my dog that weighs around 140lbs. It isn't scary at all. My dog took a few tries to get on it but now enjoys using it. Stops mid way and stands for pets! Extremely nice product, good quality. Fits my Nissan Rouge perfect. It seems like it would be slightly steep if my car was a taller vehicle like a truck but I haven't tried it to know for sure. It's a little awkward in the back seat on the floor but it definitely fits and isn't too, too thick. Slides open and closed great, stores nice and is super easy to put up on tailgate and to carry. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Makes Camping Pet Friendly!
customer_reviews.text: The ramp is very easy to set up and take down. It stores easily in the matching case we purchased (also on Amazon). It really makes getting in & out of the RV much easier for our older dog. It does help that we have 2 entrances, so we can leave it set up the entire time. The dogs immediately go to the ramp to go in, they don't even bother with the other door any more. Also useful for getting the old pup up into the truck. The ramp angle is easily adjusted by sliding it to change the length. A must buy for older dogs with hip or joint issues.
customer_reviews.author: W. Svendsen

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were needed
customer_reviews.text: We have two older Newfies, the larger of the two (150 lbs) has arthritis and is no longer able to jump into the back seat of the truck. After having her practice walking on the ramp flat, we put it to the test! The first couple of times we had to use the leash to guide her in and out, now she goes up and down on her own. It's a little cumbersome to haul out of the back of the truck and set up in the door, has to be angled, but works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2Newfs

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: I have three 75 pound dog. No bounce or flex when they walk on it. I was lucky and I did not need to train my dogs to go up or down. I would agree with previous reviews about the course sand paper type finish on the ramp. No dog can slip on this but it could be rough on the paws. I could see how the paws of a dog could get tender from using the ramp multiple times per day. I bought a long carpet runner and cut the carpet to fit the ramp to prevent wear and tear on the paws.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and mostly plastic
customer_reviews.text: It is mostly plastic. I expected it to be sturdy aluminum. Not sturdy. I was going to use this for my big dogs, but I am worried it will wobble and bounce. I care about them too much to have them fall off this ramp. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta User

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy ramp & amazing customer service!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are 65 & 78 lbs each. This ramp is a bit heavy, but it is meant for larger dogs. Very sturdy & easy to set up. I know it’s rather costly, but I researched & given the weight of the dogs, I wanted them to feel comfortable. Unfortunately the snap that keeps the ramp closed was damaged during shipping. But I contacted the company & they were amazing & immediately shipped a replacement- their support & fast response alone would have me give 5 stars. But the product is well built to deserve it also.
customer_reviews.author: FarmMom

customer_reviews.title: Great for Big Dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 165 pound clumsy Great Pyrenees and this ramp easily holds his weight and is very sturdy when he jumps on it to get into the truck. It is also wide enough that he isn't scared to negotiate it unlike the smaller ones I had. I feel this will save his knees and hips from the stresses of getting in and out of my vehicle. The only thing is because it is so sturdy it is heavy but the handle helps a lot.
customer_reviews.author: James Troche

customer_reviews.title: Stable, long, and goes compact to store in car
customer_reviews.text: The ramp comes put together and ready to use. It is very stable and long. I bought it for our pet pig. It was wide enough for her. I love that it is long and gives her time to get used to it. She did not like the texture on the ramp. I had to put down towels for her to walk on it. The texture on the ramp made the towel stay in place. When you are done, it slides back into place easily so you can put it in your vehicle. So happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: intheknow

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to assist my 75 lb dog into my truck so I don’t have to lift her. The ramp is big and strong. Quality product. But I returned it because it is too big and cumbersome for me to cart around. It takes up a lot of space and my dog didnt want to use it-she’s quite old. I would have not had enough room in my car for this and the dogs. But if you have a truck and a dog over 100lbs it is probably worth it. I just need something smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what we needed for our older dog. We have a murano so we lower the back seat skinny side. Open the back hatch put up her ramp and let her walk right on in and situate herself on the back seat larger side. So hand and easy. It is a bit long even when folded but fits in the hatch with the seat down so it is perfect for us. Nice sturdy ramp with non slip track.
customer_reviews.author: D. L

customer_reviews.title: The sandpaper surface sucks, otherwise ok
customer_reviews.text: As other have stated, the sandpaper on the walking surface is just a sh***y idea. We bought this for our English Bulldog to get into our motorhome easier and that crap surface gave him no traction. The ramp itself is sturdy and extends plenty for him to get in, but do yourself a favor and get a piece of carpet to lay on it for your dog to use. Other than the poor choice for the walking surface, we are pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: venturerider

customer_reviews.title: Great product, very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My poor old dog 100lb can no longer walk up and down steps. This ramp is sturdy, I checked out some others in pet stores and they were not study at all so I know she would have not wanted to get on them. It has a finish that makes it easy for her to grip when going up and down and she is no longer afraid to get in and out of the vehicle. I also use it to put against the back steps of my home to allow her to come and go. I would certainly recommend this product for dogs that are no longer safe using stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Limeygal

customer_reviews.title: I use it to load a mobility scooter
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to load a mobility scooter into my SUV, works great for that. I wish it telescoped into 3 pieces instead of 2, I have to lay down one of the back seats just to store the ramp. Small compensation for the convenience. Scooter's wheel base is 16 inches, this works great, and has just enough room. I will be adding a loop to the back of the ramp so that I can add a clip, just to make sure it doesn't move, would hate to damage the scooter if it slipped.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon B

customer_reviews.title: Great in a bind
customer_reviews.text: Adopted a blind dog who could not do stairs well. This was delivered all bent up because it is cheap flimsy metal. I requested a new one and noted that they may want to use more padding for the shipping. Same thing, delivered bent and dificult to slide open. This took a couple weeks to still have no working ramp. In that time we were actually able to teach Tuck how to use stairs :) Not recommended
customer_reviews.author: Ama

customer_reviews.title: Tore up dogs nails
customer_reviews.text: The coarse, sandpaper like material tore up my dogs nails to the point that he was bleeding. Became very slippery when wet and he couldn't navigate it at all. He has limited mobility and could not get a grip until I finally got rubber pads and attached them like stair rungs to the ramp. Pretty light and easy to fold up. Would not use for dogs with arthritis or hip displasia. Go for the ones with the "grassy" texture as they can grip better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great ramp
customer_reviews.text: This is a great ramp. We have a golden doodle that is 63 pounds and the walks up and down the ramp to get in and out of our SUV. It is well built, sturdy,, made out of quality materials, ease to open and fold away. The surface provides good traction. The width and the side rails provides security for him and he is not afraid to go up and down the ramp. We are very pleased with it. Glad we purchased this one. We looked at the folding one, the plastic one and made the right choice and purchased the aluminum one that telescopes.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton Hickman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent In every way.
customer_reviews.text: Lifesaver for us. We had work being done in our yard and the deck was removed. Weather set in and delayed the project longer than we had hoped. With two labradors one of which is 12, we needed to get the dogs into the yard safely and easily. I bought this ramp and was able to change the length to suit the construction. The dogs loved it due to the sandpaper like surface. I loved it due to the rubber feet that I was able to hook into the old header. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ron M

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my arthritic 12 year old dog, who can't make it up the steps very well any longer. I've had it less than 24 hours, and she figured it out the 2nd try. She is about 55 lbs. now, my other dog is about 62, and both of them on it at the same time is no problem. I live/work/travel FT in my RV-turned-tiny-home and this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: S. White

customer_reviews.title: Big Dogs
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this ramp for our ageing dog who is part Anatolian Shepherd and Great Pyrenees. It's very sturdy, has an comfortable slope for her, easy to transport, and wide enough to withstand her weight of 120 lbs. It only took her a couple days for her to maneuver it correctly with treats of course. Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JCA

customer_reviews.title: Life changer for our old girl!
customer_reviews.text: What would we do without this marvelous ramp? Our 12 year old female lab would be stuck at home, and I'm sure some people make even more dire decisions when their pets lose their mobility. The Solvit people seemed to have thought of everything here. It's manageable for 1 person, there is s sandpapery surface for the dog to walk on so they have confidence they won't fall, it's the widest ramp that we could find anywhere, and it is a reasonable length for any vehicle when it's collapsed. The only problem we had was that it needed some WD-40 oil on the sides where it slides in and out. Smooth as silk after that. Couldn't travel without it.
customer_reviews.author: mnmisser

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for my dog!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my dog is getting older and unable to jump into the back seat of my pickup (older truck with king cab). It works at any height due to the telescoping ramp. I will admit that it's night light, weighs some but it's so sturdy that I don't mind at all. I use it for my 85lb dog and now my little 15lb dog using it to get out of the truck too. Best buy for saving my dogs of injuries and extra strain on their joints. Would buy again as it's so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Rachale

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for my big, older girl!
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Rottweiler who has always been a little skittish and apprehensive about using a ramp. We recently upgraded to this ramp and the sturdiness and width has really helped us get her into our vehicle much easier, she is more confident using this ramp versus our older one which was more narrow and bent under her weight. Her back legs would sometimes fall off the old ramp, she's a little clumsy, but we don't have that problem with this ramp. Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Won't come in on time
customer_reviews.text: This product came in very late 5 days late I needed it by the time of original order was placed . Not sturdy , very cheaply made .
customer_reviews.author: Marina Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Big but great for big dogs
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is great! The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I wish it was more compact. We have a 5 series wagon and it's still too big to fit in the back along with the dog, we have to put in the backseat which isn't ideal. However, it has to be big to accommodate our 115 pound Bernese Mountain Dog puppy! With that said, it's been working great for him. It's wide and sturdy enough for him to go walk up to get into the wagon and even to use across 4 steps after his TPLO surgery (which is why we got it in the first place!) Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan E

customer_reviews.title: Use carpet runner . Problem solved!
customer_reviews.text: One day our baby “GUMBO” a Rott / Retriever mix was a happy healthy 8 yr old, and the next he had trouble walking 🙁 With that he could no longer jump into my husbands Tahoe. And Christmas to visit family was touch n go . Then we saw this ramp. Saved our holiday! Saw comments abt the sandpaper like surface of the ramp. Quick fix? Use a carpet runner . Problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: AmzPrimeVIP

customer_reviews.title: It broke in half
customer_reviews.text: I thought we would love this product until it broke in half while walking down it. We were using it for our dog to help her get out of our trailer. We were making sure it was sturdy enough and it broke. It definitely doesn't hold the weight it says it does. It is upsetting because we are past the return window and it cost a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Shady

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this due to one of my dogs having CCL surgery & we are full time in our motorhome. the surface was too slick for her to use it we tried several times but it wound up being safer for her ( very hard on me ) to lift her up ( she is 60 lbs) into the MH. I have it for sale if anyone is interested. 75 bucks you pay shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Chip In SC

customer_reviews.title: This worked great! Bought it for a dog that had CCL ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked great! Bought it for a dog that had CCL surgery that could not get up steps. I thought I would only be using this for about 8 weeks while the dog recuperated. The dog tore the other CCL a day after the 8 weeks was up. Dog had surgery on other leg so we used the ramp for another 8 weeks. After the second surgery the dog really needed the ramp. This ramp worked very well it beat picking up a 55 lb dog to get in and out of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Julieharber

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ramp but really big
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ramp because it was number 1 on Consumer Reports. It is an awesome ramp, wide and long. I did return it but only because it took up too much room in my SUV. I felt it would be too much to have the ramp, large dog and camping equipment all together. Return was super easy too. I would have kept it if it folded smaller.
customer_reviews.author: trisha

customer_reviews.title: It works for us
customer_reviews.text: It isn’t easy to slide it closed, and when fully extended, my 90 pound dog makes it flex to the point that it worries me. But it is helping our old dog navigate the front porch steps and if needed, will help with loading him into the truck. Not perfect but definitely serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: LJ's Mom

customer_reviews.title: It look like it was returned and sent to me
customer_reviews.text: The surface left like sandpaper. I think a carpeted surface would be better so a dog can get traction. This item made my dogs paws bleed. It look like it was returned and sent to me. Someone else probably had the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great engineering and construction for the purpose it is designed for
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality design and constructed to fill the purpose. Fit on the back seat of my F250 just great and solid. Took some coaxing to get my two labs up it, but success was achieved. Worked great on my travel trailer and will save my pets legs. 112 lb lab was slipping on the surface due to trying to dig his claws in, but 70 lb female had no problems. Purchased some indoor/ outdoor carpet and cut to fit. Used screws instead of double back tape or glue and I’m waiting to see if it helps the big male.
customer_reviews.author: E. Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: No-slip surface is junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knowing the surface would be bad after reading the reviews, I just didn't realize it would be THIS bad. To say it is sand paper quality is almost a compliment to the product. It's almost like straight powder. We bought it because it was the only ramp that was this long and wide, so I would not return it for that reason alone, but we will need to get some rugs or something for it.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Great ramp for my 90 pound lab
customer_reviews.text: I have used this ramp for about a month now. My lab weighs 90 pounds. I drive a Ford F-350. I purchased this ramp to replace a shorter plastic model that folded and was much harder for my dog to use. The increased width of this model makes it much easier for him to use. The telescoping action makes it easier for me as well. The surface provides good traction for the dog.
customer_reviews.author: wyomingcamper

customer_reviews.title: Not worth a $100 but didn't find a better one cheaper
customer_reviews.text: The other reviews are true, the item arrived scratched, looks cheap, the rough sandpaper surface is actually slipperycover ramp with carpet as others have recommended), you can pinch your fingers,the strap latch breaks etc. etc. BUT it serves the purpose of getting my dogs into my SUV. The ramp is wide and held still but walking up at an angle did not come easy to my dogs it took a couple of hours of training over time. I paid over $100 for the ramp, there are certainly cheaper ramps but with all being said it serves the purpose so buy it and ignore the cosmetic imperfections.
customer_reviews.author: tls78754

customer_reviews.title: very well made
customer_reviews.text: The dogs like this better than any other ramps we have tried. we have large senior shepherds and our Suburban is quite high for them to get in either the rear hatch or the side doors. The only feature lacking is a locking pin when fully extended. will buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Real mccoy

customer_reviews.title: Broken button
customer_reviews.text: My only problem with this ramp is the locking mechanism used to keep the ramp from sliding out while transporting it. To keep the ramp from sliding out there is a strip of plastic with a button that locks the two pieces together. Otherwise the two pieces will slide while trying to carry it. This button as you can see in my picture breaks of very easily. There needs to be a better method of keeping this thing from sliding out while transporting it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Solvit solved car carry for our Mastiff
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our English Mastiff (188 pounds) to protect his joints. We used bacon to lure him onto the ramp at ground level, had him walk on it on the ground a few times, then transferred it to the back of my vehicle. He uses it like a champ. It's wide and strong, has good traction, and can be telescoped to various lengths, plus it closes easily and is easy to carry. Love!
customer_reviews.author: LoveFactually author

customer_reviews.title: No bad but too narrow
customer_reviews.text: Training my lab via treats worked well but there was little maneuvering room when it was time to turn around and go back down the ramp. Also, it was not really sturdy in that it did flex under her weight, making her uneasy. Something that would support the ramp in the middle would be nice plus a wider surface.
customer_reviews.author: Dav

customer_reviews.title: Good for Large older dog In high profile vehicle
customer_reviews.text: The ramp is very sturdy and extends long enough to create a maneuverable incline for our senior 85# English lab to get into the back of my large SUV. The only negative is it is a bit heavy and awkward for his senior owner (me!) to lift and manage in and out of the back of car. Even tho it collapses in half, it is large and takes a lot of space in the back when traveling with the dog and storage in garage when not. But it does work very well and he doesn’t have a problem walking up or down the ramp.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. My 13 1/2 year old chocolate lab had gotten scared of walking up and down steps . She was afraid of it at first. Not going to use it. Nope, not doing it. She would look for any way around it. I took a couple of rugs that she was familiar with in the house and laid over the top of it. I led her down it one time and she has been using it ever since! I have left the rugs on it for traction. We live in northern MN and have below 0 temps and lots of snow. This has solved our problem
customer_reviews.author: lmd57

customer_reviews.title: Problem with this twice
customer_reviews.text: The first ramp that arrived was falling apart. The non-slip surface was peeling off. Amazon was excellent about returning the item and sending a new one. The problem is that the new one arrived and looked great. My rott started using it. It worked out well all day. By the end of the day, the non-slip surface once again started peeling off. I think there is a problem with the glue they use to seal the surface to the ramp. I may have to return this one also, but I actually love the ramp. Going to contact customer service to see if they have a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Quirk

customer_reviews.title: I weigh 200 lbs and walked down it and felt like it bows way too much
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. It is lightweight and compact when folded. The price is a little high given the materials. It is rated for 300 lbs, but I certainly would not try that. I weigh 200 lbs and walked down it and felt like it bows way too much. Overall the quality is acceptable. One minor nit is that the anti-skid covering is easily penetrated and scraped off by claws. I have two labrador retrievers that use this ramp for climbing into and out of our travel trailer. The very first use caused some of the anti-skid to scrape off. I will likely have to replace the anti-skid surface with some thicker skateboard tape or something.
customer_reviews.author: Lowflyer

customer_reviews.title: Ease of getting it set up and closed.
customer_reviews.text: The ramp is exactly what we needed for our 15 year old fur kid. He was having difficulty getting into our van and truck. The ramp is perfect. Light weight, compact and easy for Clark to walk on. It has a sandpaper like coating which I do cover with a Long Beach towel but only because I think he feels more secure. It really isn’t necessary. It also opens and closes with ease. It is made well and certainly a good investment. I would highly recommend it. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Suecen

customer_reviews.title: Have been using this at least 4 times each day ...
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this at least 4 times each day, for the past several weeks, for my 100 pound Chocolate Lab. My pickup's bed is 40" off the ground. My dog uses this without hesitation. At times, he will take a bit of a run and jump about half-way up the ramp on his way into the truck bed. This is a solid ramp; both I and my dog trust it completely. Does not slip. Set-up and set-down takes seconds.
customer_reviews.author: donj

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but watch for sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: I used the ramp for the first time yesterday and it worked well, but when I was moving it the edge caught my knuckle and cut a chunk of my skin off almost to the bone. I am going to use my Dremel to buff the edges, but please be careful. I would have expected this to be done during the manufacturing process, but nope.
customer_reviews.author: DK99203

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy with one major flaw!
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like the ramp but I was shocked looking at what the manufacturer used to presumably provide friction between the paws of our furry companions and the face of the ramp... it was sandpaper!!! Unreal and unacceptable!! I had to RIP it all of, buy carpet from homedepot, cut it to size and paste it on the ramp.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: We originally tried the plastic 2 fold version and it was too steep. Our dog is a 10 year old shep mix with a front leg amputated... he's never done ramps. He does well with stairs even with only 3 legs. He goes up it. It's pretty light and folds up nicely. The surface where the dog walks is a little rough and scratchy but doesn't seem to bother him. When it says it holds up to 300 pounds it did we used it to get a generator out of the back of our SUV and it held perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa l.

customer_reviews.title: love this ramp for my big dog
customer_reviews.text: I have 120 pound German Shepherd dog who keeps hurting himself getting in and out of the back of my truck. I tried steps, but they were just too difficult for him to manage. He learned to use this ramp very quickly and it has helped a lot. I will say, the first time he use the ramp he scratched all to heck with his toenails. Oh well, it is not about how it looks. It folds very easily and slides into the back of my truck and is not too heavy to take it in and out several times a day when necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Weil

customer_reviews.title: Bullmastiff approved
customer_reviews.text: Our bullmastiff had leg surgery and can't get in the car by himself anymore. I have a 2016 Jeep Patriot and this snugs nicely on the bumper so he can climb up into the cargo area. The part that slides out works smoothly and is sturdy so the angle is more gradual. It took some serious treat based convincing to get him to use it the first couple of times, but he's getting better. His feet do slip a little going up and there are now claw marks on the sandpaper-y surface but that was expected. Going down is a breeze. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Our lab/pyrenees just had CCL surgery and this ramp is perfect for our needs and his. The surface does feel like sandpaper and he has had no issues with slipping. So far we do not feel the need to modify the surface. Satisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Heather T

customer_reviews.title: Great for older dogs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to assist our older larger dog get in and out of an F150 with extended cab (not crew) Nice and wide for him to climb up and not too wide so it fit into the smaller area in the back of the cab. So sturdy that my dog did not balk, as he had with other types of ramps/stairs. VERY happy. One star removal because it DOES slide a bit too easy. So easy that it can surprise you when moving and give you a mild finger pinch. If you have a large or older dog, it is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: D. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Works well with an easy modification!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my lab buddy, he's getting old and was having an issue getting up into my truck. Pro-lightweight, moves easy, has a locking mechanism (a button tab) for storage, and it's sturdy. Cons- my only concern was the cheap sandpaper grip....not good for the old man. My fix...and easy suggestion....a long outdoor carpet. I measured it out fully extended just to cover the sandpaper. Cut the carpet and used 3m spray glue to apply. Worked awesome and with about 5 mins of practice, he loves it as well. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Delano

customer_reviews.title: Dog Ramp failed with 90# Lab - NO S
customer_reviews.text: This product does not hold up to it's stated weight maximum. We purchased it in Sept and just took our 12 year old Lab camping this past weekend. He weights 90# and the ramp failed/collapsed. We are outside of our "return window" so we are stuck with a poorly manufactured ramp which did not perform to the stated standard.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Petree

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Handyman quit and left our ramp unfinished. I put this ramp up to give the dogs a safe pathway to the yard. My dogs accepted it right away. The extra-long feature makes a softer incline for the dogs with mobility issues. It must be really useful for travel with pets even though mine is stationary. It is sturdy but if it's too heavy to carry back & forth to the vehicle use a rolling shopping cart!
customer_reviews.author: Madd Maxx

customer_reviews.title: so far so good..
customer_reviews.text: just got it today and so far we LOVE it !! was worried about it being safe on a tailgate of a pickup but it works perfectly. we have an 8 year old lab that just blew out her knee and had to have surgery so NO more jumping into the back for her .we bought a "Pet Loader" stair type which works great but it's SO HEAVY it was miserable trying to use it. glad i found this one and so is my VERY PICKY husband ..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It slides together instead of folding
customer_reviews.text: Works great for one of my little dogs. He's blind and has really short legs. I opened a nightstand drawer a few inches and set the end of the ramp on that. Now he can get up on the bed when he wants. This ramp is longer than most so he doesn't have a steep incline to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: PLH

customer_reviews.title: ... for my older 100 pound German Shepherd who has bad hips. He can walk right up it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my older 100 pound German Shepherd who has bad hips. He can walk right up it. I did take someone else's suggestion and added a long non slip bath rug on top of it. It barely fits in my Subaru Crosstrek with back seats folded down and is somewhat heavy and awkward for me to use by myself. This ramp doesn't flex on the middle and seems very sturdy. Overall a good ramp.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The BEST ramp I've seen
customer_reviews.text: Very well built, High quality. Telescoping helps for different situations. Sturdy but not heavy. pieces snap together for transport. Training is key, pets need to get used to stepping on it/walking on it. Instructions helpful. nice!
customer_reviews.author: Jamal

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy ramp for an 80 pound dog.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my German Shepherd who is experience maneuverability issues. With this sturdy ramp I can now load him in and out of my car by myself. It took a little training to teach him to use the ramp and he needs a spotter because he is losing his balance. We now can enjoy our car rides again as well as trips to the vet and the park.
customer_reviews.author: marla gold

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 12 year old 120 lb dog
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 12 year old 120 lb dog. It extends long enough that it isn't too steep for him to climb up and very sturdy.....it doesn't move when he steps up on it. Excellent traction as well. I tried 6 diff types of ramps before this one and he immediately felt safe on it and it only took him 4 or 5 tries before he would use it with no coaching. Would recommend this to anyone with a beloved pet needing help up !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen T

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: A little flimsier than I expected, but supported my 100# lab without any concern. If using for getting in/out of vehicles, especially trucks, be sure to block the bottom edge, as it can slip when the angie is higher. Other than that, it functions as expected, and I like that it telescopes to make it easier to transport.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Elwell

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Worked awesome for my 2 dogs, 140 and 100 lbs. Strong and sturdy but will take up some space in the car. Just make sure to train your dog to walk across it on a flat surface and then slowly raise it with bricks over time before using it. Was readying my dog for CCL surgery and feared that he would freak out and jump off going up or down. Prepped him for a couple weeks before using it and he was great.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Robb

customer_reviews.title: Great and helpful purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have a 16 year old Shepard/lab mix that I needed to get in and out of a big truck and travel trailer regularly. This has worked perfectly for me and for my furry friend. It’s definitely worth the investment to ensure my dogs safety!
customer_reviews.author: Ladycasey

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This arrived yesterday. It was very easy to set up. We use it to assist our elderly lab into the backseat of our Toyota Camry. It works great. Our dog took some time to get comfortable going up and down. But after about 45 minutes he was able to make it up and down the ramp with some gentle coaxing. The ramp itself is not too heavy. It has a handle for ease of carry. It fits nicely into the trunk of the Camry. We also bought the Solvit side door adapter for the ramp. The adapter does provide some additional stability. But, you probably could use the ramp without the adapter.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: My 110 pound Bernese mountain dog just had tta surgery and this ramp has been so helpful. Before the surgery she practiced walking on it flat and I gradually increased the incline. Now she has no hesitation and charges up and down it with confidence. Very light and easy to use. FYI I drive a Ford Escape and usually back up to a small hill in my yard to make the incline easier for her. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: tamara

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ramp!
customer_reviews.text: I have two HUGE American Mastiff dogs and an SUV to haul them around in. The telescoping feature is nice and it's thin enough where I just lay it across the back cargo compartment until I need it, it's doesn't roll around or create issues when it's not in use. Also it is easily expandable with one hand a quick tap of the foot when I'm holding back two excited dogs who know they get to run down the ramp. It holds 190+ pounds with no issues. It's not too steep, hasn't made a scratch on my bumper and the surface seems to be adequate for traction as the pups run up and down it.
customer_reviews.author: K9dogsrule

customer_reviews.title: Cheap waste of money
customer_reviews.text: We had one of these ramps for about a year before it wore out. The replacement lasted about a week. The sides completely crumpled because the aluminum was so flimsy. There was a big difference in quality from the first to second ramp.
customer_reviews.author: Velvetjane

customer_reviews.title: Extra width is great for big dogs but does not fit in every car door opening
customer_reviews.text: Love the telescoping feature and the additional width. I have two older goldens with bad hips amd one with bad vision. The additional width makes him feel more secure. I also use it to go up the front porch steps. ONLY downfall is that it is too wide to use in traditional cars and smaller SUV’s - the doors don’t open wide enough to accommodate it. It works great from the back hatch of a Cherokee or side door of a pickup truck. We put runners down on top of it because the top of the ramp is sort of like sandpaper and it freaked them out.
customer_reviews.author: SHARON

customer_reviews.title: A little heavy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my 10 year old 85# Golden Retriever that cannot jump into the backend of my SUV any longer. He was a little skittish at first, but, then got the hang of walking up the ramp. It was a bit heavy for me to collapse and lift in and out of the SUV, and took up more room than I expected. It served it purpose on a cross country road trip though.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Received Used Ramp
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived opened and ramp was used. Scratches and hair all over it. Not sure how this can happen. Somebody early dropped the ball on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: The perfect Motorcoach ramp!
customer_reviews.text: A last minute decision found us needing a ramp for our Motorcoach for a trip to jacksonville, Fl. We found this product Friday morning and couldn't believe that it was available for same day delivery via Amazon Prime. We placed the order about 7 am and by 8 pm that same day it was at our home! AMAZING! The ramp is awesome, fits in the doorway of our Monaco Dynasty perfectly, it's sturdy, collapsible and fits into basement storage compartments with ease! We used it for many things over the weekend trip, it performed perfectly! I Highly recommend this to make your lifes easier on the road!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Aurelius

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: My dogs will walk up it with not a lot of asking. I just wish I would have measured the length. I will not fit flat in the back of our CRV. It is also too wide to fit in the door. We have to use it with the back hatch only.
customer_reviews.author: ginat

customer_reviews.title: Works, but small issues.
customer_reviews.text: This was used to assist a mastiff into my RV after ACL surgery. It supported the weight and folds small enough to fit in the back of an SUV with the middle seat folded down. Two complaints: The "nonskid" is more like cheap wallpaper. It came off the very first time my dog used the ramp. It ought to be more durable. Also, there is no rubber grip or anything on the underside of the ramp so the lip will slide if lateral pressure is put on it. These issues were mitigated by making the dog walk slowly and being very careful about how I braced the ramp during use.
customer_reviews.author: Drifter1911

product_meta.title: PetSafe Happy Ride Extra Long Telescoping Dog Ramp - Portable Pet Ramp - Great for Cars, Trucks and SUVs - Durable Aluminum Frame Supports up to 300 lb - Side Rails and High Traction Surface Design
product_meta.description: Give your best friend a leg up when you go on adventures together with the PetSafe Happy Ride Extra Long Telescoping Dog Ramp. Weighing only 18 pounds, this ramp is easy for you to carry and lift in and out of your vehicle. Although light, the strong, durable aluminum ramp can support the largest four-legged friends up to 300 pounds. If your dog isn’t quite tall enough to hop in the car, or if you want to help protect his joints, the telescoping ramp gives him the freedom to easily walk in and out of your car, truck, minivan or SUV all by himself. This extra-long ramp allows you to customize the length of the ramp from 47-87 inches for vehicles with steeper inclines. The high-traction surface and side rails allow your dog to confidently walk up and down the ramp without slipping or falling. You can conveniently store your ramp by simply sliding it in and locking it with the safety latch to prevent it from opening while you are traveling in the car. PetSafe brand is here to help you and your pet live happy together.
feature_bullets: CONTINUE ADVENTURES TOGETHER: Use the telescoping ramp to help your best friend get in and out of your truck, car, minivan or SUV all by themselves to improve road trips together
EXTRA LONG ADJUSTABLE SIZING: Longer length and extra wide telescoping ramp allows you to help your pet get in and out of vehicles with steeper inclines; ramp measures 47-87 in L X 20 in W X 4 in H
SAFETY TESTED & DURABLE: This strong ramp is independently tested and rated to support pets up to 300 lb
LIGHTWEIGHT: Weighing 18 pounds the ramp is easy to carry and lift in and out of the car between stops
NO SLIPPING: High-traction surface and side rails keep your furry friend from slipping or falling when walking on the ramp
SIMPLE TO STORE: Ramp easily slides inward and locks with the safety latch to let you conveniently store it in your vehicle
QUALITY GUARANTEED: PetSafe brand has been a trusted global leader in pet behavior, containment and lifestyle innovations for nearly 30 years; we help pets and their people live happily together
U.S.-BASED CUSTOMER CARE:  Let our pet product experts help; we’re available Monday through Saturday to answer your questions at 1-800-845-3274
